intro: Apicra congesta, commonly known as the dense apicra, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a hairy texture, while its stems are often covered in fine pubescence. Apicra congesta is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
